You are given a function that applies a two-qubit transformation. This transformation can be one of two types:

1.  $I \otimes X$ (The X gate is applied to the second qubit, and the first qubit is unchanged).
2.  CNOT (The first qubit acts as a control, and the second qubit acts as the target).

You can apply this function, its inverse, and a controlled version of it exactly once. Your goal is to figure out which type of transformation was applied and return 0 if it was $I \otimes X$ and 1 if it was the CNOT gate.

You will be given a function that takes an array of two qubits as input. Your task is to write a function that takes this function as input and returns 0 or 1 based on the type of transformation.

You are given a function that performs one of two operations on two bits. You can apply this function, its reverse, or a modified version of it once. Your goal is to figure out which of the two original operations was used.
